SourceString: Choose the areas of specialization for your divine power. What type of hero will you become? You can pick any two Masteries in any order and combine their strengths in interesting ways. Each Mastery can be specialized as you progress.
DevComment: This is where the concept of masteries is explained in a paragraph.

SourceString: Masters of Earth harness the powers of fire and stone from deep underground to shape and ignite the battlefield, crushing their foes and setting them ablaze.
DevComment:
Original: Masters of earth magic don't just control the power of rock to defend themselves and shape the battlefield, but also call forth fire from deep underground, setting their foes ablaze.
Proposal to reflect EA mastery more

SourceString: Masters of Storm control the battlefield by conjuring the forces of lightning and ice to rain down on their enemies, and can even embody the storm itself.
DevComment: Maybe get rid of the "or?" Up the fanciness a bit?

SourceString: Masters of Warfare excel at confronting their enemies directly, slaying entire armies on the battlefield with a variety of weapons and audacious tactics.
DevComment: Masters of warfare wade into the front lines and attack their foes directly. They excel at ripping enemies to shreds using physical weapons and bolstering the attacks of themselves and their allies.

SourceString: Rogues are masters of precision, preparation, and evasion. They strike at their enemies\' weaknesses and utilize poisons, then move away before the enemy has a chance to fight back.
DevComment:
Original: Rogues are masters of precision, preparation, and evasion. They strike at their enemies' weak points, utilize poisons and traps, then vanish before the enemy has a chance to fight back.
Propoal to reflect EA mastery more

SourceString: Bend the earth itself to your will!
DevComment: This is kinda doubled with battlefield etc in the description
Struggling with "wreak havoc" a bit, what could be a good other verb?
This sounds cool, but what about the others?
All invested passive and active mastery points will be refunded.

SourceString: Are you sure you want to choose the {Mastery} mastery?\r\nThis cannot be undone.
You have not progressed the story enough to unlock a mastery yet.
No blessings. No miracles. Just raw strength, hard-earned skill, and the will to endure.

Silent hunters forged in fire and stone, Ashstalkers poison their prey while wielding the destructive power of flame and earth. They stalk the battlefield unseen, setting traps of burning fury and striking with lethal, calculated blows.

Commanders of raw elemental forces, Elementalists wield the primal power of storm and earth to devastate their foes. From searing firestorms to crackling lightning strikes, they shape the battlefield with destructive magic and unyielding power.

A force of nature on the front lines, Battlemages combine martial prowess with the fiery resilience of earth magic. They dominate in even the most brutal combat, blending powerful weapon strikes with devastating elemental spells to crush their enemies.

Masters of cold calculation and electrifying speed, Stormblades use ice and lightning magic to weaken foes before striking from the shadows. Their poisons and precision combine with elemental fury to freeze and shock enemies into submission.

Savage and cunning, Reavers blend brutal frontline combat with deadly precision. They strike swiftly from the shadows, exploiting weaknesses with ruthless efficiency, then plunge into the fray wielding weapons with unmatched ferocity.

Harbingers of chaos on the battlefield, Tempests merge the raw force of weapon mastery with the power of lightning and frost. They weave through enemy lines, freezing and shocking anyone who dares to stand against them.
- {Ability}: Due to Modifier cost changes, one or more of your Modifiers have been unequipped to fit the ability\'s Capacity Limit.
- {Ability}: Due to changes to a Passive, one or more Feats couldn\'t be selected anymore.
- {Ability}: Due to Modifier cost changes, one or more of your Modifiers have been levelled down to fit the ability\'s Capacity Limit.

SourceString: On use gain <me_Overwhelm>Overwhelm</> while you have an <me_Overwhelm>Overwhelm</> skill equipped.
Masters of the Forge build clever contraptions and unstoppable armors, powering their creations with Divine Cores ripped from the souls of fallen foes.

Devastators are masters of divine flame, both burning their enemies with its power directly, and using it to forge the most powerful divine tools and armor to defend themselves. When a devastator arrives on the battlefield, few escape unburned.

Stormwrights shoot lightning and frost from their fingertips, slaughtering foes from afar while encased in armor and defended by constructs. They can even infuse their contraptions with power drawn from the heart of the storm.

Bastions are forces to be reckoned with on the battlefield, bristling with heavy weaponry and defended by the best armor and contraptions. If a Bastion sets their mind to holding a pass, not even an army is getting through.

Saboteurs slip in behind enemy lines, assassinate key targets, place traps, and then summon mighty armor if they’re cornered. Saboteurs are as comfortable on the front lines as they are in the shadows.
